title: How to Cheat on a Test Using Clothing

steps.title: Write all of the test answers, notes and any other important information on a piece of paper.
steps.content: Write all of the test answers, notes and any other important information on a piece of paper.

steps.title: On the test day, wear a long-sleeved shirt or hoodie.
steps.content: On the test day, wear a long-sleeved shirt or hoodie. Hide your notes in your sleeve.

steps.title: Slowly and silently slide the piece of paper bit by bit out of your sleeve.
steps.content: Slowly and silently slide the piece of paper bit by bit out of your sleeve. Never totally remove the paper from you sleeve. Only pull out enough to reveal the information you need. This method is much easier if you are near the back of the class.

steps.title: Rip off a piece of paper, maybe about 5" by 5".
steps.content: Rip off a piece of paper, maybe about 5" by 5".

steps.title: Write all of the test answers, notes and any other important information on the paper.
steps.content: Write all of the test answers, notes and any other important information on the paper.

steps.title: Tape the cheat-sheet into the hood of your hoodie on the day of the test.
steps.content: Tape the cheat-sheet into the hood of your hoodie on the day of the test.

steps.title: Put your hoodie on backwards, so that the hood is in front of you.
steps.content: Put your hoodie on backwards, so that the hood is in front of you. (If you're wearing a pullover hoodie, only put your arms in so that the hood is again in the front of your body.

steps.title: Look at the paper, easily, whenever needed.
steps.content: Look at the paper, easily, whenever needed.

steps.title: Tape a piece of paper with your note on it inside a baggy hoodie.
steps.content: Tape a piece of paper with your note on it inside a baggy hoodie.

steps.title: Pull off your hoodie during the test, and as you do so look at the note taped on the inside.
steps.content: Pull off your hoodie during the test, and as you do so look at the note taped on the inside. Put it back on later to hide your answers again.

steps.title: Write down the test notes and answers on a piece of paper.
steps.content: Write down the test notes and answers on a piece of paper. Place the notes inside your hat.

steps.title: Wear the hat to class on the day of the test.
steps.content: Wear the hat to class on the day of the test.

steps.title: During the test, take off your hat to adjust your hair.
steps.content: During the test, take off your hat to adjust your hair. While doing so, look inside your hat for the notes. The hat will obscure your notes from your teacher and other students. Keep in mind that many schools have rules against nonreligious headwear, and even if it is allowed, it may not be in that particular classroom or for a test. Find out your school's policy on this.

steps.title: Write down the test answers and notes on a piece of paper.
steps.content: Write down the test answers and notes on a piece of paper.

steps.title: Tape the paper to the sole (bottom rubber part) of your shoe on the test day.
steps.content: Tape the paper to the sole (bottom rubber part) of your shoe on the test day.

steps.title: During the test, just cross your legs in a way that the answers are very visible to you, and if any teachers come nearby, just put your feet flat on the ground.
steps.content: During the test, just cross your legs in a way that the answers are very visible to you, and if any teachers come nearby, just put your feet flat on the ground.

steps.title: Start wearing gloves to school about three weeks before the test.
steps.content: Start wearing gloves to school about three weeks before the test.

steps.title: Write down your answers and notes on paper.
steps.content: Write down your answers and notes on paper.

steps.title: Stick your notes inside your gloves on the test day.
steps.content: Stick your notes inside your gloves on the test day. Look for fashionable hand gloves at shops like Claire's and Hot Topic.

steps.title: Wear a layered ruffled skirt to class.
steps.content: Wear a layered ruffled skirt to class.

steps.title: The night before the test, write down the answers to the test in the layers of your skirt.
steps.content: The night before the test, write down the answers to the test in the layers of your skirt. Note: Be careful what you use to mark your skirt. You want to use something light. And, of course, you don't want to use anything permanent. Write small!

steps.title: Look at your notes by pretending to be smoothing out your skirt.
steps.content: Look at your notes by pretending to be smoothing out your skirt.

steps.title: When you get home after the test, bleach your skirt before it stains.
steps.content: When you get home after the test, bleach your skirt before it stains.

steps.title: Write the answers on a piece of paper or cloth and pin them to the inside of your skirt.
steps.content: Write the answers on a piece of paper or cloth and pin them to the inside of your skirt. Lift it up when nobody is watching, and you have your answers. Even if you are "caught", no teacher, especially a male one, is going to ask you to show your answers.

steps.title: Make sure you have a belt, and cut out a piece of paper slightly shorter than the height and width of the belt, and about 6-10 inches (16-26 centimeters) long.
steps.content: Make sure you have a belt, and cut out a piece of paper slightly shorter than the height and width of the belt, and about 6-10 inches (16-26 centimeters) long.

steps.title: Write out all of your notes on the piece of paper (one side only), then attach it to the inside of your belt.
steps.content: Write out all of your notes on the piece of paper (one side only), then attach it to the inside of your belt.

steps.title: On the day of the test, make sure you are wearing the belt, and that it is relatively loose.
steps.content: On the day of the test, make sure you are wearing the belt, and that it is relatively loose.

steps.title: When you want to read the notes, simply suck in your stomach, and read from the inside of your belt.
steps.content: When you want to read the notes, simply suck in your stomach, and read from the inside of your belt. This may work better if you tuck in your shirt beforehand, so that it does not seem odd that you are lifting up your shirt.

steps.title: Write some study notes on a small piece of paper and slip it under a wristband.
steps.content: Write some study notes on a small piece of paper and slip it under a wristband.

steps.title: When the teacher isn't looking, slide it out and take a peek.
steps.content: When the teacher isn't looking, slide it out and take a peek. This can be done in several different ways: You can put your head down on your desk as if you are thinking, and look. You can even ask to go to the bathroom and look at them in there.

steps.title: Make sure that the paper is not sticking out!
steps.content: Make sure that the paper is not sticking out!

steps.title: Obtain a large locket necklace with a long chain, the larger the better, and write notes on small slips of paper and stick it in the locket.
steps.content: Obtain a large locket necklace with a long chain, the larger the better, and write notes on small slips of paper and stick it in the locket.

steps.title: During the test, act like you're fooling around with your necklace, and open it and see your notes.
steps.content: During the test, act like you're fooling around with your necklace, and open it and see your notes.

steps.title: Write your notes on a piece of paper.
steps.content: Write your notes on a piece of paper. Note cards are recommend since they don't crinkle or bend.

steps.title: Put your notes in your hoodie pocket.
steps.content: Put your notes in your hoodie pocket.

steps.title: Sit behind someone so that your are obscured from the teacher's view.
steps.content: Sit behind someone so that your are obscured from the teacher's view.

steps.title: Try not to take too long; teachers likely notice who finishes last and especially if the student does surprisingly well given that it took them so long to complete it (for the excuse "I was being careful and taking my time" can only work so many times).
steps.content: Try not to take too long; teachers likely notice who finishes last and especially if the student does surprisingly well given that it took them so long to complete it (for the excuse "I was being careful and taking my time" can only work so many times). They're bound to get suspicious.

steps.title: Write your notes on a piece of paper.
steps.content: Write your notes on a piece of paper.

steps.title: Wear your winter jacket with a ski pass pocket.
steps.content: Wear your winter jacket with a ski pass pocket.

steps.title: Hide your notes in the pass pocket.
steps.content: Hide your notes in the pass pocket. Make sure the notes aren't obscured by hook-and-loop fastener.

steps.title: If you manage to get your hands on an answer sheet before the test, make yourself a bracelet with different colors of string.
steps.content: If you manage to get your hands on an answer sheet before the test, make yourself a bracelet with different colors of string. It'll look like one of those knotted friendship bracelets, but match each color to a letter and you'll be all set. For example if A: Green, B: Yellow, and C: Pink if the answers were B, C, A, A, B then it would go yellow, pink, green, green, yellow. This method works for multiple choice tests only.

steps.title: If you wear glasses take a piece of paper, write your notes on it, fold it up and hide it in the hinge.
steps.content: If you wear glasses take a piece of paper, write your notes on it, fold it up and hide it in the hinge. When you need them take off your glasses and take the paper and unfold it. If the teacher asks what you're doing say your hinge has a gap and is 'uneven' and you're adjusting the paper.

steps.title: When you are done, fold it back up, put it back and continue.
steps.content: When you are done, fold it back up, put it back and continue.

steps.title: Throw out the paper later on.
steps.content: Throw out the paper later on.

steps.title: Buy a pocket watch that has a lid.
steps.content: Buy a pocket watch that has a lid.

steps.title: Tape a piece of paper with your notes onto the watch.
steps.content: Tape a piece of paper with your notes onto the watch.

steps.title: Pretend to check the time.
steps.content: Pretend to check the time. This works best on timed tests. Teachers will just think that you are checking the time.

steps.title: Start to wear a sweatband to school a few weeks before the test, as if to make it seem like an item that you're going to wear periodically.
steps.content: Start to wear a sweatband to school a few weeks before the test, as if to make it seem like an item that you're going to wear periodically.

steps.title: Prepare a mini sheet of paper and attach it to the sweatband.
steps.content: Prepare a mini sheet of paper and attach it to the sweatband.

steps.title: Check your notes by taking it off and when done, put it on the same wrist.
steps.content: Check your notes by taking it off and when done, put it on the same wrist.

steps.title: Get rid of the notes, and continue wearing the sweatband for a week or so.
steps.content: Get rid of the notes, and continue wearing the sweatband for a week or so.
